description: ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY FRONT, REAR AND SIDE EXTENSIONS, BASEMENT TO REPLACE EXISTING, A NEW RAISED ROOF WITH DORMER WINDOWS TO ACCOMMODATE HABITABLE ROOMS, AMENDMENTS TO EXISTING ELEVATIONS AND ASSOCIATED EXTERNAL LANDSCAPING.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Drawing no. 421(PL)00 (Location Plan) 
Drawing no. 421(PL)06(Proposed Site Plan)
Drawing no. 421(PL)08 9 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan)
Drawing no. 421(PL)07 (Proposed Basement Plan)
Drawing no. 421(PL)09 (Proposed First Floor Plan  
Drawing no. 421(PL)10 (Proposed Loft Plan) 
Drawing no. 421(PL)11(Proposed Roof Plan) 
Arboricultural Method Statement' reference 'CCL11236 Rev.1' and dated '29.9.2022' .
Design & Access Statement Part 1 and Design & Access Statement Part 2 Dated November 2022 . 
Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 4 - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.
Condition : 5 - Tree Protection: The details and measures for the protection of the existing trees as specified in the hereby approved document 'Arboricultural Method Statement' reference 'CCL11236 Rev.1' and dated '29.9.2022' shall be fully complied with. The methods for the protection of the existing trees 2 shall fully accord with all of the measures specified in the report and shall be installed prior to the commencement of any site works and shall remain in place until the conclusion of all site works. 

Reason: To protect and safeguard the existing trees in accordance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 7.21 of the London Plan 2015, policy CS13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2 and 02 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.





Condition : 6 - Site Supervision (Trees) - The details of the approved 'Arboricultural Method Statement' shall include the retention of an arboricultural expert to monitor and report to the Local Planning Authority not less than monthly the status of all tree works and tree protection measures throughout the course of the demolition and site works. A final Certificate of Completion shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority at the conclusion of all site works. The works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Arboricultural Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan. 

Reason: To protect and safeguard etc. 




Condition : 7 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the the new rooflight window in the north-east side roof elevation shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.
Condition : 8 - No demolition or construction work or ancillary activities such as deliveries shall take place before 8am or after 6pm Mondays - Fridays inclusive, before 8am or after 1pm on Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.
Condition : 9 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.
   ii) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
